EVERYBODY. All you have to do is right click on the sh2.exe, navigate and make sure the "Run as Administrator" is checked, then press Apply and then make sure the "Run in Windows XP SP2" is selected, then press Apply and okay.

SOLUTION FOR RUNNING UNDER WINDOWS 7

Download Affinity.exe (game doesn't like dual core)
create a SilentHill2.bat (create a *.txt and rename it to *.bat)
put the affinity.exe and the SilentHill2.bat in your SilentHill2 folder (in this example i will use C:\SilentHill2)
type the following text into the SilentHill2.bat file:

affinity Sh2pc.exe (if you renamed your silent hill exe, you have to rename this entry too of course)

Start the game with the *.bat file

tested under win 7 64x

You don't have to download and install anything to make it run under Windows 7/Dual Core processors. 

Just start the game -> alt-tab out -> start Task Manager -> locate sh2pc.exe -> right-click and select Set Affinity -> Check only a single processor -> Start playing

Only downside to this, is that you have to do it every time the game starts up.

TO ANYONE WHO HAS BEEN HAVING TROUBLE WITH CUT SCENES –

I had the same problem as someone posted earlier with cut scenes freezing a couple of frames in, and not being able to proceed without skipping them.

The game crashed shortly after first experiencing this problem, and when I started it again, it complained that I had had it on a "dangerous" graphics setting, and launched in a lower resolution. The cut scenes worked again after this. So try fiddling with those settings.

Works brilliantly once you use the instructions that everyone has posted.  However this might be a helpful hint to people that are still having problems.    
Even after trying every trick posted the game continued to crash for me at startup.  I managed to isolate the problem to my digital sound.  I use hdmi to deliver my sound to a receiver.  I decide to switch my playback device to the analog outputs on the back of my pc.  Viola the game started and I've been playing without a hitch.
It seems for me that hdmi sound was causing the  game to crash on my pc.

for those having problems with the cutscenes and having trouble with quiting the game etc,do this, right click on sh2pc (application),click the compatibility tab check the box compatibility mode and choose Windows XP (service pack 2),right below in the (settings) check all the boxes and also check the box that says run this program as an admin,click ok and then start the game,this will fix your problem, by the way im using windows 7 64 bit and this worked for me.
